page.title: 09THE SANKEY VALLEY PROJECT.
page.content: The Sankey Valley project that stretches from the Ship Inn on the A-58 to Carr Mill Dam, was built in 1757 and was the first canal in Britain. Of the original network the best surviving stretch is at Bradleigh. This part of the canal was constructed between 1755 and 1757. Since 1979 the valley has matured and development work has been continuing between Carr Mill Dam and Newton Brook. The park is laid out to achieve a balance between creating a habitat for the rich wildlife of the valley and conserving any industrial remains found along it. Extensive and varied footpaths lead into a wide range of landscapes and habitats :- (woodland, meadow, canalside, ponds and views out over farmland).
